author: wsjcom
title: Exclusivity Explains Only One Part of Anti-Semitism
text:
Regarding Reuven Brenner’s “The Roots of Anti-Semitism” (Houses of Worship, May 11): Anti-Semitism started when ancient Hebrews declared there was only one God, and that was their God. The subsequent monotheistic, Abrahamic religions, Christianity and Islam, have frequently done the same thing. To many of the faithful, their God was the “one true God,” justifying the religious wars that have characterized the three faiths.
Irving Rikon
